hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation-Cluster Catalyst Retest Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When a catalyst triggers a violent liquidation event (>$300M cross-crypto in 1H) that pushes price through a high-liquidity zone (e.g., major options strike, yearly open), a retest of the post-liquidation extreme within the next 12 hours will fail 70% of the time, offering a high Sharpe fade opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Violent liquidations are often exacerbated by derivative mechanics and represent a local exhaustion of momentum. The retest of the extreme often lacks the same selling/buying pressure, as forced positions are already cleared. The Dec 19 move (CPI, $600M liquidations) is a prime example.
entry_conditions: Catalyst triggers >$300M in cross-crypto liquidations (long+short) within 1 hour.
Price moves >5% during the liquidation hour, clearly sweeping a known liquidity zone.
Price then retraces >30% of the liquidation candle's range.
Price re-approaches within 0.5% of the liquidation candle's extreme (wick) over the next 12 hours.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 50% retracement level of the initial liquidation candle's range.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: A confirmed 1H close >0.5% beyond the liquidation extreme.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A study of >30 similar events shows the retest leads to a continuation beyond the extreme >50% of the time, invalidating the fade premise.
